title: Federated Learning Design and Optimization in Wireless Edge Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamentals of machine learning, basic concepts of wireless communication, and experience with Python programming
context.additional_context: Students engage in simultaneous theoretical learning and practical exercises using personal devices, demonstrating practical skills through project-based assessments. They simulate wireless edge computing environments centered on language domain cases

learning_goals: Explain the operational principles and two-tier hierarchical structure of federated learning in wireless edge environments
Mathematically model an optimization problem analyzing the trade-off between communication costs and learning performance
Implement hierarchical clustering methods to design a federated learning system that reflects data importance across devices
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
